N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 3.22 - Provisional charter

State Regulations
A provisional charter shall be granted for a period not
exceeding five years, but may be extended by the Regents, during which period
the institution holding such charter shall have an opportunity to meet the
requirements for an absolute charter. The institution shall have under such
provisional charter all the powers, privileges and obligations that it would
have under an absolute charter, except that it shall not have power to confer
degrees. In the case of an institution of higher or professional learning, including, but not limited to colleges, universities, schools of law, medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, veterinary medicine, nursing, optometry, podiatry, chiropractic, architecture or engineering, the institution shall submit
evidence in writing which, in the judgment of the Regents, makes it appear
likely that the institution will be successful in achieving registration of is
academic programs. Notes
